documentation.title: File Header
documentation.standard: The header of a PHP file may consist of a number of different blocks. If present, each of the blocks below MUST be separated by a single blank line, and MUST NOT contain a blank line. Each block MUST be in the order listed below, although blocks that are not relevant may be omitted.

code.title: Valid: Correct ordered blocks and separated by a single blank line.

code_comparison.code:
<?php

/**
 * This file contains an
 * example of coding styles.
 */

declare(strict_types=1);

namespace Vendor\Package;

use Vendor\Package\{
    ClassA as A,
    ClassB,
    ClassC as C
};
use Vendor\Package\Namespace\ClassD as D;
use Vendor\Package\OtherNamespace\ClassE;

use function Vendor\Package\{
    functionA,
    functionB,
    functionC
};
use function Another\Vendor\functionD;

use const Vendor\Package\{
    CONSTANT_A,
    CONSTANT_B,
    CONSTANT_C
};
use const Another\Vendor\CONSTANT_D;

<?php
/**
 * File-level docblock
 *
 * must not contain blank lines.
 */
declare(strict_types=1);
namespace Vendor\Package;

use Vendor\Package\{
    ClassA as A,
    ClassB,
    ClassC as C
};
use function Vendor\Package\{
    functionA,
    functionB,
    functionC
};
use Vendor\Package\SomeNamespace\ClassD as D;
use const Vendor\Package\{
    CONSTANT_A,
    CONSTANT_B,
    CONSTANT_C
};
use function Another\Vendor\functionD;
use Vendor\Package\AnotherNamespace\ClassE as E;
use const Another\Vendor\CONSTANT_D;
